trans-unit.source: Contains properties that specify how an application should behave relative to new WPF features that are in the WindowsBase assembly.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether information about the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.Priority"></xref> is saved to the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref>.
The default value of this property depends which version of WPF that your app targets.
If your app targets WPF 4.0 or earlier, the default is `false`.
If your app targets WPF 4.5, the default is `true`.
If you use this property to change the behavior of WPF, you must change the property’s value early in the app’s lifetime, such in the constructor of the class that inherits from Application.
After the value is read, you cannot change it again.

`true` if information about the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.Priority"></xref> is saved to the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext.Send(System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback,System.Object)"></xref> method puts the delegates on the dispatcher queue or if the delegate is directly invoked.
The default value of this property depends which version of WPF that your app targets.
If your app targets WPF 4.0 or earlier, the default is `false`.
If your app targets WPF 4.5, the default is `true`.
If you use this property to change the behavior of WPF, you must change the property’s value early in the app’s lifetime, such in the constructor of the class that inherits from Application.
After the value is read, you cannot change it again.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext.Send(System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback,System.Object)"></xref> method puts the delegates on the dispatcher queue or if the delegate is directly invoked; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a single <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref> is used for multiple dispatcher operations.
The default value of this property depends which version of WPF that your app targets.
If your app targets WPF 4.0 or earlier, the default is `true`.
If your app targets WPF 4.5, the default is `false`.
If you use this property to change the behavior of WPF, you must change the property’s value early in the app’s lifetime, such in the constructor of the class that inherits from Application.
After the value is read, you cannot change it again.
true if a single <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref> is used for multiple dispatcher operations; otherwise, `false`.
